abstract: NBC is dramatically switching around its line-up to salvage what has been a weak television season.
snippet: NBC is dramatically switching around its line-up to salvage what has been a weak television season.
lead_paragraph: NBC announced wholesale changes to its struggling prime-time schedule Monday, highlighted by an all-comedy night on Thursdays, which includes a move of the much-awarded “30 Rock” to 10 p.m., followed by the new comedy “Outsourced,” which has been the network’s best-performing new series this fall.

headline.main: NBC Scrambles Jets: ’30 Rock’ Moves to 10; ‘Event’ On Hold
